content.question:
<math alttext="2 N O 2, gas, is in equilibrium with N 2 O 4, gas. K sub c, equals 200." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>â‡„</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="4.0em"></mspace><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>200</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

The equilibrium system shown above is represented in the diagram below in which each molecule represents one mole of the substance in a <math alttext="100, decimal point, liters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> container at a constant temperature.

Additional <math alttext="N 2 O 4, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is added to the container and allowed to reestablish equilibrium. Which of the following best represents the system after the equilibrium has been reestablished?

choices.label: The figure shows four molecules. One molecule is represented by two shaded circles connected to each other and each shaded circle is connected to two smaller unshaded circles. The other three molecules are represented by one shaded circle connected to two smaller unshaded circles.

The figure shows five molecules. Two molecules are represented by two shaded circles connected to each other and each shaded circle is connected to two smaller unshaded circles. The other three molecules are represented by one shaded circle connected to two smaller unshaded circles.

The figure shows six molecules. Four molecules are represented by two shaded circles connected to each other and each shaded circle is connected to two smaller unshaded circles. The other two molecules are represented by one shaded circle connected to two smaller unshaded circles.

The figure shows ten molecules. Eight molecules are represented by two shaded circles connected to each other and each shaded circle is connected to two smaller unshaded circles. The other two molecules are represented by one shaded circle connected to two smaller unshaded circles.

content.answer: The figure shows ten molecules. Eight molecules are represented by two shaded circles connected to each other and each shaded circle is connected to two smaller unshaded circles. The other two molecules are represented by one shaded circle connected to two smaller unshaded circles.

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
